content.text:
# Selaserica nuwarana

Selaserica nuwarana is a species of beetle of the family Scarabaeidae. It is found in Sri Lanka.
Description
Adults reach a length of about 9.4â€“10.9 mm. They have a reddish brown, oblong body, with yellowish brown antennae. The dorsal surface is moderately shiny and nearly glabrous except for some long, fine setae on the elytra.
Etymology
The species is named after its type locality, Nuwara Eliya.
